item.description:
ATTENTION Members:  Unfortunately, organizer has a concussion and is unable to travel.  

But you can still meet and discuss info described on the links below, as well as on the "pages" tab above. Please  leave feedback on this site indicating how your Meetup went, okay?

The reason I don't want you to have to wait till next time to meet is because....

Extremely challenging times will soon be upon us, due to several situations which have reached a critical threshold. 

To better understand why our very survival depends upon personal preparedness steps we  take now, please view the following links:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eidQTDjQ5gw   (Crash Course - The Three E's)

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nI-BIVWlc7A    (Resources & Monetary Systems)

http://www.krystalspiral.com/CamelotInterviews.htm (2012 Cosmic Energy Changes)

NOTE:  Next month's topic will be Eco-Dome Homes, as described below.

If members wish to discuss a different topic next time, please contact organizer who will post it. Call organizer on 603-286-8191. 

Organizer is not checking e-mails.   

The Eco-Dome is a small home design of approximately 400 square feet (40 sq. meters) interior space. It consists of a large central dome, surrounded by four smaller niches and a wind-scoop, in a clover leaf pattern.

Learning and building an Eco-Dome is the next stage after building a small emergency shelter and provides hands-on learning experience in the essential aspects of Superadobe construction. It's small size of approximately 400 square feet (interior space), makes it a manageable structure for the first time owner builder.

The finished "very small house" shown here is self-contained and can become a small guest house, studio apartment, or be the first step in a clustered design for community use in an Eco-Village of vaults and domes.

Members are requested to view the following links before attending:

http://calearth.org/building-designs/eco-dome.html  http://www.nextworldtv.com/videos/shelter/eco-dome.html                                     

PLEASE NOTE:   If the Celery Stick Cafe is too crowded and you don't see a Meetup sign there, go to Borders Books in a plaza on Ft. Eddy Rd.  This is the "backup plan" for Thursday night Concord Meetups. But if we meet at the Celery Stick Cafe,  please plan on purchasing something to eat during the meeting.

The quickest way to contact the group organizer is by sending an e-mail to info@ulcsclinic.com.  Please enter "Meetup Member" in subj. line.  Organizer does not check the address associated with the Meetup site.
item.how_to_find_us: Suggest members carry Meetup signs to identify each other.

group.name: Back to Basics: Sustainable Self-Sufficient Healthy Living

item.name: Understanding Challenging Times Which Lie Ahead.
